content: ninja creami cozy pattern by melissa miller stitchermel notes this pattern uses us crochet terms this is my first time writing a pattern so please forgive me if there are errors materials yarn lion brand 24/7 cotton or any worsted weight cotton hook 3 5mm us e accessories yarn needle and scissors gauge 8 stitches and 6 row in 2 of body pattern although gauge isn t necessarily important on this project as it can be customized by using any yarn hook and container then made to size abbreviations chain - chain st/sts - stitch/stitches single_crochet - single_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet fpdc - front post double_crochet increase - increase two single_crochet in a single stitch pm - place stitch marker special stitches front post double_crochet fpdc yarn over insert hook front-to-back through the post of the next double_crochet yarn over and work as a double_crochet camel stitch instead of inserting the hook through the v at the top of the stitch from the previous round look for the angled stitch behind the v on the back side of the row which is known as the third loop on a half_double_crochet stitch yarn over insert hook into the third loop and work as a half_double_crochet base the base is worked in a spiral so you will not be slipping stitches to join the rounds start with a magic_ring make 6 single_crochet inside the ring tighten magic_ring to close row 1 two single_crochet in each stitch around 12 single_crochet pm in the last single_crochet round 2 *single_crochet in the first st from the hook increase in the next st* repeat around 18 sts round 3 *2 single_crochet increase in the next st* repeat around 24 sts round 4 *3 single_crochet increase in the next st* repeat around 30 sts round 5 *4 single_crochet increase in the next st* repeat around 36 sts round 6 *5 single_crochet increase in the next st* repeat around 42 sts round 7 *6 single_crochet increase in the next st* repeat around 48 sts i have the original model of the ninja creami and it took seven rounds for me to get the base to the correct diameter if you have a different size container simply use this increase pattern until it s the right diameter for the container you are using it could be fewer row for a smaller container or more row for a larger container once the desired diameter is reached you may remove the stitch marker as it will no longer be needed sides this can be worked in a single color or worked in multiple colors to create stripes row 8 chain 2 this does not count as your first double_crochet double_crochet in each stitch working in the back loop only at the end of the row slip_stitch into the top of the chain 2 to close the round row 9 chain 2 double_crochet fpdc repeat between brackets until the end of row slip_stitch into the chain 2 to close
